noun.description: A drink, remedy, or extract prepared by soaking the leaves of a plant or herb in liquid.
The introduction of a new element or quality into something.
examples: the infusion of $6.3 million for improvements

noun.description: The slow injection of a substance into a vein or tissue.

origin: Late Middle English (denoting the pouring in of a liquid): from Latin infusio(n-), from the verb infundere (see infuse).
